thread.title: Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1
thread.title_full: Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1

title: Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1
text:
Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
Montreal Canadiens defenseman P.K. Subban, right, and center Tomas Plekanec congratulate goalie Mike Condon as the Canadiens defeat the Ottawa Senators in an NHL hockey game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
Montreal Canadiens goalie Mike Condon makes a save during the second period of an NHL hockey game against the Ottawa Senators, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
Ottawa Senators center Jean-Gabriel Pageau tries to put the puck past Montreal Canadiens goalie Mike Condon during the second period of an NHL hockey game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
Montreal Canadiens center Tomas Plekanec puts the puck past Ottawa Senators goalie Matt O'Connor during the first period of an NHL hockey game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
A fan cheers as Montreal Canadiens defenseman P.K. Subban jumps into the arms of teammate Torrey Mitchell after he scored during the third period of an NHL hockey game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Adrian Wyld Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 
Ottawa Senators goalie Matt O'Connor makes a save on Montreal Canadiens right wing Alexander Semin during the third period of an NHL hockey game, Sunday, Oct. 11, 2015 in Ottawa, Ontario. (Adrian Wyld/The Canadian Press via AP) MANDATORY CREDIT Posted: Sunday, October 11, 2015 10:38 pm Plekanec scores twice, Canadiens beat Senators 3-1 Associated Press | 0 comments 
OTTAWA, Ontario (AP) â€” Tomas Plekanec scored twice in the first period and Mike Condon made 20 saves in his NHL debut to help the Montreal Canadiens beat the Ottawa Senators 3-1 on Sunday night. 
The 25-year-old Condon allowed only Jean-Gabriel Pageau's short-handed goal midway through the second period in the Senators' home opener.
